intro: Bouchea cernua, commonly known as the nodding bouchea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its pendulous, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers, which range from pink to red, bloom in late spring to early summer. Bouchea cernua is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
